So this is just a casual review from someone that does not overly take the game serious so don't try to use this as a "This is 100% the reason I'm getting/not getting this game".

From a Casual stand point where you just play this during those hours where you got nothing much else to play. This game can be pretty fun, but also can be very annoying to play. It's a mix bag of good and bad points that you can probably easily read from other reviewers out there. The only 2 key issues to be perfectly frank is slight balancing issues (you need specific perks if you want to get very far) and some of the community toxicity (which is to be expected in practically any Player vs player game).

As long as you don't take most of the people that just start randomly cursing you out, it only really leaves one issue of certain killers being better than others and specific perks being ran because they're practically required most of the time.

Now then, my perspective on both playing Killer and Survivor...

Killers tend to be more entertaining to play as since if you play well enough without actually sitting 2 centimeters next to the guy you just hook to have a staring contest with, it can be satisfying to actually get a win out of it, or at least be happy with the points you get after the match finishes. As long as you get enough separate hooks out of all of them, it can usually be more than what you can earn as a survivor. Just be sure to face a wall when you pick someone up and avoid trying to do it near a pallet if you can.

Survivors on the other hand, in early rankings you can have a somewhat easy time since some killers are either just doing their dailies or just getting used to playing something new. Mid-ranks tend to be a tad more difficult as to be expected and High ranking being near impossible for someone that doesn't have all the high ranking perks.
[Most of this however can be made indefinitely easier with the right Survive with Friends group which can be easily found on the Dead by Daylight Discord or with your own friends that may own the game.]

All in all, the game can be really fun. Just some people rather ruin the fun for others with petty insults. Just ignore those kinds of people and always be sure to at least drop a gg.

My opinion about this game, you can agree or disagree the choice is yours. DBD started out a really good game but after time the developers stopped listening to the community and just totally wrecked the game. Killers still get the hit if you pallet drop. There are very few pallets now than there were in the beginning. The has been completely handed to the killer. The community is soooo toxic, it just makes you so sick to even play. This game  is a perfect example of developers trashing a good game. Now that they have added END GAME, and here is my take on how stupid it is. If you are the last survivor and the hatch opens, forget it. The killer shuts the hatch immediately which leaves you to proceed to the doors, forget that too. Killer camps both doors, sooo... game is already handed to the killer. End Game was a horrible idea to force the survivors out. 
Survivor perks are worthless  since garbage killers use at least 3 perks to see where survivors are at all times. And your going to run into those killers 99.9% of the time. Lobbies suck since 9 out of 10 lobbies you get with a killer in China.. so yeah 300-400 ping; with no region restrictions. It's too easy to be killer these days since perks allow you to see where everyone is and there is no balance. 
I would advise not to buy this game at all, spend your hard earned money on something else that is better and where a developer actually listens to the community and cares about its fans.

Being one of the only of it's kind, balancing this game is pretty rough. You have some casual players, and some who want competition, and then the fact that the game is, by engine, going to be biased towards survivor, with how many more survivor only players there are then killer. When you have a 4v1 asymmetrical game like this, majority of the playerbase will be that 4, so patches and balance tend to lean towards them, as they also complain the most. That being said, all things considered, including the spaghetti code, balance issues, bugs, and overall let downs of new content, I do think the devs are on their way to improving the game, just very slowly. Truthfully even as I said many bad things about it, the game is easily one of my favourites, and has only become more fun with the deeper knowledge gained from playing. I hope the developers continue to take risks rather than making small, insignificant changes, and aren't afraid to get backlash for making another strong killer or really shaking up the experience. We've already seen some mobile games that are clones of DBD, and they have some very interesting ideas. I personally, would love to see this genre explored outside of BHVR, but for now, they've done a pretty good.... Job so far.

У нас было 2 маньяка, 75 кемперов, 5 мансеров, полсолонки самохила и гора НОЕДов, барбекью и всего такого, всех цветов, а ещё литр слез выживших, литр пота, ящик аддонов, пол-литра лечащих средств и две дюжины мементо мори. Не то, чтобы это всё было нужно чтобы хорошо провести время, но раз начал играть в дбд, то иди в своём увлечении до конца. Единственное, что меня беспокоило — это кемперы. В мире нет никого более беспомощного, безответственного и безнравственного, чем маньяк который никогда не отходит от крюка. И я знал, что довольно скоро нам придется бороться и с этим.

Les recomiendo que no gasten plata en este juego mal hecho por su bien estar mental. Gasten se la plata en otro juego que no se está basura. Los creadores no arreglan la mayoría de bug visual y físicos del juego. si tuviera la ocasión de rembolsarlo lo haría. Me arrepiento de gastar mi dinero en esta basura de juego

The game is good.
The balance team, well, that's a different story.
Play the game casually, and you'll have a blast. Get invested, get to high ranks, and that's when things get messy. People aren't exactly forgiving in this community, and that's partly because the game has had so many exploits and imbalances through its lifespan that getting to a high rank basically requires them. If you play the game the way it's intended, you don't win. Or, at least, that's how it's been for a while.

Nowadays, disconnecting due to internet issues doesn't lose you rank, so high rank games see people disconnecting their own internet left and right because there's really no downside to it. The best part to this is that if survivors d/c and the killer sacrifices whoever hasn't disconnected, there's a decent chance the killer will actually lose rank, because the system for gaining ranks is just as unforgiving as the balance between perks.

Like I said, the game is good. It's fun. You just can't take it too seriously. It's not a competitive game, and sadly, I don't think it ever will be.

But that doesn't mean I can't bong my bell.
I will bing bong my bell.

good premise for a game but terrible execution. The game only has one mode, terrible matchmaking which results in you either matching up with killers that kill everyone at 5 gens or if your the killer being matched with swf teams. All while the whole gameplay is holding m1 on gen and waiting for the killer to chase you for 30 seconds more less until they down you. And don't forget about people being toxic just because, they had one bad game prior, so they have to make your game terrible too. Overall fun for the first 50 or so hours but then shits the bed because they only add new killers and survivors and nothing eles.
